name: All Paws on Deck Animal Rescue
description: All Paws on Deck is a 501 (c) (3) nonprofit dog rescue organization based in Connecticut that is dedicated to rescuing and rehoming pregnant dogs and their puppies.

name: A Better Life Rescue
description: A Better Life â€“ Pet Rescue, Inc. helps to promote the adoption of rescued animals throughout Central Florida. We believe that every animal deserves a second chance through rescue and rehabilitation.

name: Bully Up Rescue
description: We are a 501c3 non-profit, volunteer, foster-based organization located in Central Florida. We aim at restoring the positive image of the bully breed.

name: Ewenity Farm Herding Dog
description: We are a small, foster-based rescue organization serving the state of Florida and the southeast United States.

name: Furever Bully Love
description: Saving the misunderstood. Foster based Florida 501c3 non-profit specializing in bully breeds. Voicing the voiceless

name: Husky Haven
description: Husky Haven of Florida is an organization 100% run by volunteers. If you'd like to help make a change, all you need is a little time and a lot of passion for this beautiful breed and rescue.

name: Lakeland Pitbull Advocates
description: Through community outreach, we help dogs get vetted, neutered, and spayed, and provide food for those in need.

name: Our Cause 4 Paws
description: Here at Our Cause 4 Paws Rescue, we're committed to investing our expertise and resources in order to help dogs in need.

name: Paws of Hope Dog Rescue
description: We are a dog rescue located in Haines City, FL. Officially opened in October 2023, but we have been "unofficially" rescuing animals for over 15 years.

name: Polk County Bully Project
description: We believe that we can end breed discrimination and cruelty by working together through education and community support.

name: Polka Dogz
description: Our mission is to rescue, rehabilitate, and re-home dogs while educating the community on responsible pet ownership.

name: Poodle and Pooch
description: We rescue the "leftovers" from animal control, the dogs nobody wants because they're older or suffer from neglect, abuse or have a medical need.

name: Rescue Rebels
description: Since 2016, Rescue Rebels has fostered and placed hundreds of rescue dogs in their forever homes.

name: Touch of Grey
description: Our goal is to take as many senior and special needs dogs as we can out of the shelter environment.

name: Treasure Fur-Ever Pet Rescue
description: We are dedicated to finding loving forever homes for dogs and cats in need.

name: Pet Project USA
description: We strive to make a lasting impact on animal welfare through collaborative efforts with underfunded shelters and communities

name: Happy Trails
description: We opened a brand new Community Resource Center for pet owners in 2019 that services Orange, Osceola and Seminole.
location: Orange, Osceola and Seminole Counties, FL
